title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B suggests split from Stefon Diggs during her 'Little Miss Drama' tour stop in Los Angeles.
Cardi B and Stefon Diggs unfollowed each other on Instagram following the Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs, facing battery and strangulation charges, pleaded not guilty in Massachusetts court on February 13.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A judge ruled UMass likely violated Junior Kivlighan de Montebello's free speech rights by suspending him for a protest.
Montebello was suspended for a year after protesting RTX's recruitment at a campus career fair in September 2025.
Justice Trapani required UMass to lift Montebello's suspension and prohibited further sanctions during ongoing legal proceedings.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes charged with motor vehicle homicide in Brockton hit-and-run; victim Alfredo Alves, 23, died.
Hayes allegedly struck Alves after leaving a Brockton strip club while off-duty with friends on February 17, 2026.
Hayes, a police officer since 2014, is on administrative leave and held on $15,000 bail after court arraignment.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: Cleaning foggy headlights removes the protective coating, causing them to refog; a ceramic coating can last up to a year.
AAA studies indicate foggy headlights can block 90% of light, suggesting regular cleaning can maintain visibility and safety.
Owners facing unexpected car part failures are advised to address issues directly with manufacturers, preferably via a formal letter.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway for child rape and human trafficking after a Boston police investigation.
Garcia faces multiple charges including child rape, trafficking, and possession of child sexual material; he pleaded not guilty.
Released on $5,000 bail, Garcia must avoid contact with the alleged victim and not be alone with children, except his own.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide after a hit-and-run in Pittsfield, involving victim William Colbert.
Colbert, 69, was dragged four miles after being struck at Linden Street/Francis Avenue intersection, found dead near a hotel.
Gross arrested after investigation, will be arraigned Wednesday in Central Berkshire District Court, facing multiple charges.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Hereâ€™s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Massachusetts RMV is holding a lottery for 1,000 low-number MA250 commemorative license plates.
The application period for the license plate lottery is February 16 to April 17, 2026.
Winners will be announced five business days after the first week of May's electronic lottery visit.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts will use ChatGPT AI for executive branch's 40,000 employees, starting with the Technology Services and Security office.
AI assistant implementation aims to enhance government efficiency but faces skepticism from state workers and the National Association of Government Employees.
The new AI tool will be securely isolated, with state data protected from public AI training, amid concerns about job impact and privacy.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles will close two packaging plants in Gardner, Massachusetts, laying off 91 employees by the end of September.
The packaging company was acquired by Astara Capital Partners in 2021 and rebranded to honor founder Pete Garlock in 2023.
Originally founded in 1987, Garlock began with paper packaging solutions and expanded operations to Reno, Nevada, in 2013.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife Rhonda Dorgan and son Aidan Dorgan at a Pawtucket hockey rink.
Rhonda Dorgan's parents and family friend Thomas Geruso were critically wounded in the shooting.
Robert Dorgan acted alone, shot himself, and police are investigating motives including social media activity.
